name: Psych-DS 'Infomative Mistakes' Dataset
description: This is a minimal example of a dataset which is several key mistakes away from being a valid Psych-DS dataset.

variableMeasured.name: rt
variableMeasured.description: Response time from stimulus onset to button press

variableMeasured.name: condition
variableMeasured.description: Experimental condition code (numeric placeholder for between-subjects manipulation)

variableMeasured.name: trial_type
variableMeasured.description: Type of trial (e.g., 'Stimulus Response', 'Survey Likert')

variableMeasured.name: stimulus
variableMeasured.description: HTML string or symbol presented as the stimulus

variableMeasured.name: response
variableMeasured.description: Participant's keypress or selection response

variableMeasured.name: leftDots
variableMeasured.description: Number of dots on the left side of the display

variableMeasured.name: rightDots
variableMeasured.description: Number of dots on the right side of the display

variableMeasured.name: dot_difference
variableMeasured.description: Absolute difference in dot count between left and right sides

variableMeasured.name: correct
variableMeasured.description: Indicates whether the participant's response was correct (1) or incorrect (0)

variableMeasured.name: confidence
variableMeasured.description: Confidence rating provided by the participant after making a decision

variableMeasured.name: slider_start
variableMeasured.description: Theoretical initial position of the confidence slider (though not displayed to participants)

variableMeasured.name: phase
variableMeasured.description: Experiment phase label (e.g., 'Practice', 'Test')

variableMeasured.name: correct_key
variableMeasured.description: Key that corresponds to the correct answer on the given trial

variableMeasured.name: target_left
variableMeasured.description: Whether the target stimulus was on the left side

variableMeasured.name: time_elapsed
variableMeasured.description: Elapsed time in milliseconds since the start of the experiment

variableMeasured.name: trial_index
variableMeasured.description: Index of the trial in the full timeline

variableMeasured.name: browser
variableMeasured.description: Web browser used by participant

variableMeasured.name: browser_version
variableMeasured.description: Version of the web browser

variableMeasured.name: os
variableMeasured.description: Operating system of the participant's device

variableMeasured.name: mobile
variableMeasured.description: Indicates whether the device was a mobile device

variableMeasured.name: fullscreen
variableMeasured.description: Indicates whether the experiment was conducted in fullscreen mode

variableMeasured.name: webcam
variableMeasured.description: Indicates whether webcam access was granted

variableMeasured.name: microphone
variableMeasured.description: Indicates whether microphone access was granted

variableMeasured.name: webaudio
variableMeasured.description: Indicates whether web audio was available

variableMeasured.name: width
variableMeasured.description: Width of the browser window in pixels

variableMeasured.name: height
variableMeasured.description: Height of the browser window in pixels

variableMeasured.name: vsync_rate
variableMeasured.description: Vertical sync rate of the display in Hz

variableMeasured.name: plugin_version
variableMeasured.description: Version number of the plugin used for the trial

variableMeasured.name: participant_id
variableMeasured.description: Anonymized unique participant identifier

variableMeasured.name: Source
variableMeasured.description: Source or platform of participant recruitment (e.g., Prolific, SONA)

variableMeasured.name: success
variableMeasured.description: Indicates success status of applying full screen

variableMeasured.name: view_history
variableMeasured.description: A record of the views/screens presented to the participant during the instructions

variableMeasured.name: baseline
variableMeasured.description: The baseline number of dots used in the non-target stimuli

variableMeasured.name: increment
variableMeasured.description: The dot difference between the target and non-target stimuli

variableMeasured.name: current_log
variableMeasured.description: The current staircase value in log-space

variableMeasured.name: value
variableMeasured.description: The return value of the jsPsych call-function. Typically blank

variableMeasured.name: trialnum
variableMeasured.description: Index of the trial within the current block

variableMeasured.name: blocknum
variableMeasured.description: Index of the block within the experiment
